snippet: President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad of Iran proclaimed defiantly on Tuesday that the country had such plentiful reserves of money that it could survive for years without exporting any oil.
abstract: Iranian Pres Mahmoud Ahmadinejad defiantly proclaims that his country has sufficient monetary reserves to survive for years without exporting oil; far-reaching sanctions have significantly diminished demand for Iranian oil, disrupting the country's banking system, contributing to inflation and increasing deprivations suffered by ordinary Iranians.
lead_paragraph: President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad of Iran proclaimed defiantly on Tuesday that the country had such plentiful reserves of money that it could survive for years without exporting any oil.

headline.seo: President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad Says Oil Embargo Won’t Hurt Iran
headline.main: Iranian President Says Oil Embargo Won’t Hurt
headline.print_headline: Iranian President Says Oil Embargo Won’t Hurt
